New Records: Cavaliers became the 4th NBA team to start a season at 15-0
James Harden surpassed Ray Allen for second place on the NBA’s all-time 3-point list
Key Match Events: Darius Garland led the Cavs with 25 points and 12 assists
Ty Jerome matched his career-high in both points (24) and assists (8)
Evan Mobley and Jarrett Allen added double-doubles for the Cavs
LaMelo Ball led the Hornets with 31 points and 12 assists
The Hornets made it a three-point game entering the 4th quarter
Cleveland outscored Charlotte 26-15 in the final frame to seal the win
Julius Randle delivered a game-winning 3-pointer at the buzzer for the Timberwolves
Kevin Durant and Bradley Beal were sidelined for the Suns
Devin Booker had a season-high 44 points
Anthony Edwards finished with a season-high 35 points, seven assists, and five 3s
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland Cavaliers started the season with a 15-0 record
James Harden surpassed Ray Allen for second place on the NBA’s all-time 3-point list
Devin Booker had a season-high 44 points
Timberwolves' Julius Randle and Anthony Edwards delivered a game-winning 3-pointer at the buzzer
Kevin Durant and Bradley Beal were sidelined for the Suns
Post-Match Reflections: James Harden expressed pride in his career achievement
Timberwolves' Julius Randle said he came through for the team with the game-winning 3-pointer
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland Cavaliers are the 4th team to start a season at 15-0, matching the second-best start in NBA history
James Harden's record-breaking moment occurred in the first quarter
Kevin Durant and Bradley Beal were sidelined for the Suns
Devin Booker had 27 points in the first half to help Phoenix build a 16-point lead
Julius Randle and Anthony Edwards helped the Timberwolves back from a 16-point deficit
Others: The game featured a 15-0 record for the Cavaliers
The game was part of Week 2 of the Emirates NBA Cup
